title: Complementary angles
text: When two angles are complementary, it means their measures add up to $$90$$ degrees.

title: First equation
text: Since the problem identifies the angles as complementary, we know that they add up to $$90$$ degrees. Therefore, the first equation should be $$a+b=90$$.

title: Second equation
text: The problem mentions the difference between the two angles is $$17$$ degrees. Because of this, we can write the second equation as $$a-b=17$$.

title: Solve
text: Next, using the system of equations just created, solve for a. What does it equal?

title: Answer
text: The two angle measures are $$53.5$$ degrees and $$36.5$$ degrees.
